timeline.bodyText:
This should rather be to catch AlreadyExists on create, then to do previous check.
Since while you check for an existing artifact, and you get false, one can be created.
Highly unlikely, but still better to handle it "defensively", as that way there is no concurrency error.
timeline.author: alesj

replies.bodyText: Even doing that we probably have a race condition in the Streams storage implementation when running more than one instance, right?
replies.author: EricWittmann

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure it would be a race condition, since all artifacts with same artifactId are handled on the same node, in ordered (sync) fashion.
For create, if two requests would be concurrent, one would fail -- see StreamsRegistryStorage impl.
For update, it would also fail -- if someone would delete the artifacts during that async op.
replies.author: alesj
